candidates.title: Bump bevy_rapier to 0.18
candidates.body: Group is now less transparent since it uses the `bitflags` macro, but looks good aside from that.

candidates.title: Port to bevy 0.8
candidates.body: This is still missing an issue with the impl_for_simple_enum macro that I don't know enough about macros to solve

candidates.title: Marker sensor/bump bevy_rapier to 0.15
candidates.body: Need to figure out if there is a better way to just show a marker component here. But should fix any conflicts with the current version

candidates.title: Update bevy_rapier to 0.14
candidates.body: It doesn't seem like there are any breaking changes affecting `bevy-inspector-egui`, so the update is pretty trivial.

candidates.title: Upgrade to bevy_egui 0.12
candidates.body:
There are two notable changes:
- As `bevy_egui` tracks ids of user textures itself, I removed `id_of_handle` and updated the relevant code.
- I had to remove the `layout_job` macro (now it's just a function), as `TextFormat` uses `FontId` instead of `TextStyle`, which can't be constructed just with an `ident`.

The changes compile, but I haven't tested them very extensively.

candidates.title: add vec_as_dropdown example
candidates.body:
Hey,
Loving the inspector.

This wasn't obvious for me as a first time user, and would seems to be a fairly common use case. Hopefully it helps someone else..

VecAsDropdown works over a Vec of
    T: Clone + Display + PartialEq + Debug + Default,

from the code:
```
impl<T> Inspectable for VecAsDropdown<T>
where
    T: Clone + Display + PartialEq + Debug + Default,
{
    type Attributes = Vec<T>;
```

Thanks!

candidates.title: Update bevy_egui to 0.5
candidates.body:
I noticed this was behind the current bevy_egui release because I kept seeing multiple versions of bevy_egui being compiled so I decided to upgrade it.

I ran most examples as a sanity check and they all seemed to work. All the test also pass.

I tried updating other outdated crates, but it required actual change in the code.

candidates.title: Add more docs to WorldInspectorPlugin and update world.rs example
candidates.body:
Great plugin, good docs! But I still got confused, so I decided to add a little more docs and update example for editing custom components with `WorldInspectorPlugin`

You can see my confusion in this issue #12 

English is not my first language, so please correct my phrasing where needed :)

candidates.title: Add support for Rapier
candidates.body: Ok better PR this time, with an actual widget for RigidBody. For the `nalgebra_conversions`, I copy/pasted the nalgebra/glam conversion traits I use in [my app](https://github.com/willcrichton/crateton/blob/master/src/math.rs) because interfacing with Rapier is hell otherwise. Ideally this would use mint or something, but I haven't figured out a better way yet.

chosen_pr.title: Bump bevy_rapier to 0.18
chosen_pr.body: Group is now less transparent since it uses the `bitflags` macro, but looks good aside from that.
